full_text: Public science helps us see how America’s laws & policies impact American families and communities. We need to know if that science is being filtered for power or profit. #ScienceMatters
The Trump Administration has also falsified scientific claims to justify restrictions on birth control access. #ScienceMatters
Staff at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) were even banned from using the words “evidence-based” and “science-based” in budget documents. #ScienceMatters
Federal scientists have been prohibited from speaking about #climatechange and climate data have been scrubbed from many U.S. Government websites. #ScienceMatters
The President has signed 13 congressional resolutions rolling back science-based protections, including for safe drinking water and worker exposure to chemicals on the job. #ScienceMatters
President Trump has proposed vast #research downgrades including a 72% cut to federal clean energy research. #ScienceMatters
At the urging of the chemical industry, @EPA has scrapped its own recommended ban on #chlorpyrifos, a pesticide shown to impair brain development in young children. #ScienceMatters
On August 18, 2017, the National Academies of Sciences, Engineering, and Medicine were ordered to stop research on health risks for communities living near surface coal mining sites. #ScienceMatters
The U.S. Office of Science & Technology Policy (OSTP) has lost more than half of its staff since the start of this Administration #ScienceMatters
Tired of science taking a back seat to politics? So am I. That’s why I’m supporting strong public Scientific Integrity standards today and every day. #ScienceMatters #HR1358

full_text: @NTIAgov I also co-chair the Heritage Area Caucus and am pleased that we were able to secure $500,000 increase for Heritage Partnership Programs. Thanks to innovative public-private partnerships, each dollar we spend attracts an average of $5.50 in additional private funding.

@NTIAgov Historic sites & cultural centers instill in us a sense of place. They can also be important economic drivers: America’s museums spend $21 billion in their communities every year & employ 400,000 Americans. We secured $3 million under this deal for the Office of Museum Services.

Broadband Internet has gone from a luxury to an economic necessity. Our Capital Region still has homes & businesses without this access. We worked to secure an additional $2.1 billion to expand rural broadband access and $7.5 million for @NTIAgov to improve its broadband maps.

The Weatherization Assistance Program (WAP) helps low-income Americans improve the energy-efficiency of their homes. Democrats fought to secure $248 million for the #weatherization program, another one the President attempted to eliminate.
That's in addition to securing $47 million more for the Department of Energy Advanced Research Projects Agency-Energy (ARPA-E), a major source of cutting-edge U.S. energy research.

America’s competitors around the world are spending heavily on clean energy, and we are barely keeping up. Disregarding the President’s requested cuts, we were able to add $231 million to the Department of Energy Office of Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy (EERE).

@EPA @CDCgov Foreign interference in the 2016 election is well-documented, despite many denials by President Trump. Thankfully the President’s opinions had little to do with the outcome here, which yielded $380 million in new funding to help states protect election systems from cyber threats.

@EPA This budget deal loosens the gag on @CDCgov #gunviolence research, opening a door that has been closed for more than two decades. The bill also strengthens the background check system and helps cash-strapped school systems looking to invest in greater #schoolsafety & security.

Thanks to Democrats, President Trump got none of his desired cuts to @EPA. Staff members at this agency work tirelessly every day to ensure pollution and contaminants can be kept out of the water we drink, the air we breathe and the soil that helps grow the food on our tables.

86% of U.S. households depend on public water systems, many of which need major repairs or replacement. My colleagues and I secured $300 million in additional funding for states to repair drinking water systems & $300 million more to support state-run clean water programs.

We also secured $1.6b for Community Health Centers on the front lines of the #OpioidCrisis. And despite the President's proposal to cut them, Substance Abuse Prevention and Treatment grants will continue to deliver lifesaving treatment to some 1.5 million individuals every year.

As America’s #opioidcrisis continues to worsen, the need for a national response becomes ever more urgent. I am proud to report that my Democratic colleagues and I were able to secure $3.2 billion for programs that specifically address the #OpioidEpidemic.

This bipartisan budget agreement include dozens and dozens of critical wins in other vitally important areas that will help millions of Americans. Many were opposed by President Trump and Republican leaders. They are included largely because I and other Democrats fought for them.

We still have a tremendous amount of work to do on these and other related issues, including securing universal background checks on all firearm sales and protections for undocumented individuals who were brought to America as children and now face deportation by this President.
Overall, the other priorities represented in this bill will help millions of Americans who are still being largely ignored and forgotten by this President and Republican leaders in Congress.
...this bill avoids foolish, costly and unpopular spending on a border wall and other misguided priorities that would do little to address the major issues with our border or our immigration system.

While I remain deeply concerned by blockbuster military spending increases and broader budgetary issues less than a year after Republicans voted to add some $2 trillion to the deficit to give tax breaks to the wealthy...

...and critical funding for proven safety net programs such as Head Start, home #weatherization, community #health centers, #manufacturing growth, heritage areas, #museums and #libraries, and much more.

...support for states to make urgent drinking water repairs and upgrades, mental health treatment and training, advances in clean energy research, improvements to our broadband Internet maps and America’s transportation systems...

Today’s bipartisan budget agreement reflects major priorities that my Democratic colleagues and I have been actively pushing for months to achieve, including major steps forward in combating the #OpioidEpidemic, addressing gun violence research...

After repeated delays and years of painful cuts, Republican leaders in Washington seem to have finally realized that their partisan crisis-driven governing does not serve the needs or best interests of the American people.

May her extraordinary legacy continue to guide us, and may her family find peace in in the knowledge that her spirit lives on in all who were lucky enough to know her well. 

Rest in peace, my friend.
Working with Louise taught me a great deal about how to be a better public servant and I will forever miss our countless conversations and her warm and wise counsel.

Louise touched the lives of many with the warmth of her smile and sweet sound of her Kentucky accent. Her determination to fight for the people of New York & our nation will long be a shining example for aspiring young women and all Americans of good conscience & selfless heart.
When she spoke it was with conviction, charm, intellect, integrity, and a force that felt at times like it would raise the Capitol dome.

Louise was beloved by many for her lifetime of service to the people of Rochester. Her fierce and principled leadership as the dean of our New York delegation and as the first woman ever to chair the House Rules Committee elevated our work in Congress every single day.

History will remember Louise Slaughter as one of the most respected and dedicated members ever to walk the halls of Congress. I will remember her as a dear and loyal friend. As she would say, I will miss her like a front tooth. https://t.co/8ColMsfZ9L

full_text:
Bottom line: H.R. 3387 is a smart, long-overdue bipartisan bill that has already passed out of committee and is ready for a final vote on the House floor.

Every life & every job depends on access to safe, clean drinking water. Let's get this done.

7. Provide additional support to disadvantaged communities by increasing the maximum and minimum amounts of DWSRF assistance for these communities.

8. Encourage the use of asset management by drinking water systems.

5. Require water systems serving 3,300+ persons to monitor for unregulated contaminants, such as PFOA (current minimum = 10,000)

6. Extend the time for DWSRF loans to be repaid in full from 20 years to 30 after a project’s completion, and up to 40 for disadvantaged communities.

3. Provide $750m over 5 yrs, to support State water offices through the Public Water System Supervision grant program.

4. Require water system risk assessments reviewing resilience of systems from malevolent acts & natural hazards, such as extreme weather events.

Among other things, this bill would:
1. Require “Buy America” & prevailing wage standards to ensure American workers are benefiting from our investments.

2. Establish $5m/yr grant program to help schools & daycare centers with drinking water fountains that have lead components.

H.R. 3387 reflects the tough bipartisan work & best ideas from Republicans and Democrats that have come together to address our drinking water needs, a great and growing national #infrastructure challenge.

My friend @RepShimkus & I also worked together to craft H.R. 3387, the Drinking Water System Improvement Act of 2017, a major bipartisan bill that was passed out of our Environment Subcommittee, the broader Energy & Commerce Committee & now awaits a vote by the full House.

For the past three Congresses, I have introduced the AQUA Act (H.R. 1071) to provide significant support through DWSRF to state and local governments that are working to maintain, upgrade and replace their existing local drinking water systems: https://t.co/vPv9tnzMRX

We can deal with this, and we can do it now. Congress needs to reauthorize the Drinking Water State Revolving Fund (DWSRF), the primary source of federal funding for drinking water infrastructure financing.

We haven't done this in 21 years.

The news isn't all bad. Businesses are more likely to consider areas with modern water systems over places where water safety, reliability, or affordability is a concern. And according to @BGAlliance, $1 billion invested in water infrastructure creates more than 20,000 jobs.

Tragedies in Flint, Hoosick Falls and beyond show real dangers to public health. There may be as many as 10 million lead service lines currently in use across the U.S. Many of our schools have drinking fountains with lead components. 

Those numbers should be zero.

Every time "boil water advisory" or "water main break" shows up in your local news, that's your drinking water system breaking. 

Across the U.S. there are more than 700 water main breaks every day.

Outdated drinking water systems aren't just more expensive to maintain & likely to fail. Leaking pipes lose an estimated 7 billion gallons of clean drinking water every day. That's treated drinkable water, our tax dollars & utility payments, racing down the drain.
@EPA These are major systems. Albany, New York alone has 317 miles of pipes, some dating back to the Rutherford B. Hayes administration (135+ years old).

This is America's reality. 86% of U.S. households rely on public water. In 2013, the @EPA estimated $384.2 billion would be needed in the next 20 years just to keep these systems in working order. https://t.co/Bl1yYjEHlj

@SecretaryPerry @theNASEM @NewYorkISO @nationalgridus Americans need & deserve a reliable, resilient, modernized and affordable electricity system. We can thank our regulators, grid operators and utilities for all the work they have done thus far, and hope they continue to take a thoughtful approach on the future of our grid.

/end

@SecretaryPerry @theNASEM @NewYorkISO @nationalgridus No doubt our electricity system is changing and will continue to do so. In my view, it is trending in favor of consumers and the environment, as well as toward greater grid reliability.

@SecretaryPerry @theNASEM @NewYorkISO @nationalgridus Increasing grid resilience in the short-term also has important implications for long-term planning to reduce carbon emissions and help temper the worst effects of #climatechange. 

This should guide us as we work to develop a smarter grid and cleaner energy mix.

@SecretaryPerry @theNASEM We certainly owe a big #ThankYou to our grid operators (@NewYorkISO), utilities (@nationalgridus and GIPA), and all the linemen and crews who have braved the hostile chill to keep the lights, heat and power on.

@SecretaryPerry @theNASEM The recent extreme winter conditions have reminded us that a diverse mix of generation is important for reliability and resilience. 

But we should not fall into the trap of assuming that equates with fuel assurance.

@SecretaryPerry @theNASEM This must include supporting the deployment of distributed energy resources, including storage and microgrids. These resources will improve grid reliability and resilience. We must also encourage hardening of traditional transmission & distribution (T&D) infrastructure.

@SecretaryPerry @theNASEM As we move past the #NOPR, we should concentrate on the real issues that will promote a stronger grid, including the need to make MAJOR research & development (R&D) and #infrastructure investments in order to build the grid (and the generation mix) of the future.
@SecretaryPerry Consider, for example, the National Academies @theNASEM U.S. electricity system resilience report recommendations: https://t.co/afuPhHOXZT https://t.co/wMM1IhONt2
@SecretaryPerry We should certainly be exploring these questions as we invest in rebuilding #PuertoRico’s grid and continue debating #infrastructure and budget priorities in Congress.

Future disruptions from cyber or physical attacks & extreme weather may be inevitable.

I disagree with @SecretaryPerry's proposal but grid resilience needs attention from regulators & policymakers. Our grid operators should be equipped to review & strengthen systems as needed.
Consider, for example, that coal cannot generate electricity when waterlogged from flooding, and is just as unusable when it freezes.

#FERC made the right call here in rejecting DOE’s misguided #NORP Grid Reliability and Resilience Pricing proposal. This proposal would have hurt electricity markets & cost ratepayers significantly while not actually achieving its stated goals of improving grid resilience.

This week the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission rejected a proposed Trump Administration coal subsidy that was being masked as a boost to grid resiliency: https://t.co/D0pT76JTwM

The #GOPTaxScam repeals the Disabled Access Tax Credit that helps small businesses provide access to disabled individuals, a group that includes many of America's veterans.

The #GOPTaxScam also means higher costs & less opportunity for America's veterans. 

First, it repeals the Work Opportunity Tax Credit that encourages employers to hire veterans who have a service-connected disability, are unemployed, or who receive supplemental food assistance.

The #GOPTaxScam bill even eliminates the $250 above-the-line deduction for teachers' out of pocket expenses. 

Remember, our average American teacher spends about $500 of their own money every year to make sure their students have what they need.
Wait, there's more. The #GOPTaxScam also hurts students paying tuition & anyone paying student loans. Around half of the individuals & families that take these deductions make less than $50,000/year.

11,000+ individuals & families in #NY20 making under $75,000/year filed returns with a combined $185 million in medical expenses in 2014.

Ripping up this deduction takes money out of the pockets of New York seniors & families with major healthcare costs. These are our neighbors!
It gets worse! #GOPTaxPlan rips up medical deductions even though 73% of people who claim it earn less than $75,000/year.

#GOPTaxPlan raises taxes on MILLIONS of America’s middle class & working poor families to pay for HUGE tax breaks for millionaires & wealthy corporations.

@CDCgov Let's follow the facts we have from science, medicine & experience and take the steps most likely to deliver results before it’s too late.

@CDCgov Whatever you believe about #addiction, there is one common, absolute & indisputable truth: we must act quickly or things will only get worse
@CDCgov These sobering numbers, a death rate = one commercial airliner crashing every day for a year, should be a wake-up call for all of us.
@CDCgov That puts # of overdose deaths last year higher than deaths at the peak of HIV/AIDS epidemic in the 1990s, another true health emergency.
2016 was the deadliest year yet. @CDCgov estimates 64,000 ppl died of drug overdoses last year, an astonishing 21% increase from 2015!
More institutions should learn from them. I will be offering a bill to restore #Medicaid addiction treatment to patients 30 days pre-release
We are not without success stories. Rikers Island Correctional Facility has maintained successful medication-assisted treatment since 1987.
Individuals reentering the community after incarceration are 8x more likely to suffer an overdose in their first seven days out of prison.
In our nation’s jails & prisons, incarcerated people are routinely denied medication for #addiction because of the stigma around treatment.

Today, just 1 in 5 individuals struggling with #opioid use are receiving treatment for this disease.

We need to fix the treatment gap.
